questions.question: What is 'quantum decoherence' in the context of quantum mechanics?
options: It refers to the loss of information from a system into the environment
It is the measure of the unpredictability of a quantum state
It is the transition of a system from a pure state to a mixed state
All of the above

questions.question: What is 'quantum chromodynamics'?
options: A theory of the strong interaction
A theory of the weak interaction
A theory of the electromagnetic interaction
A theory of the gravitational interaction
questions.correct_answer: A theory of the strong interaction

questions.question: What are 'virtual particles' in quantum field theory?
options: They are particles that exist permanently
They are particles that pop in and out of existence
They are particles that only exist in a superposition of states
They are particles that only exist when observed
questions.correct_answer: They are particles that pop in and out of existence

questions.question: What does the 'Bell's theorem' state in quantum mechanics?
options: It states that certain predictions of quantum mechanics are incompatible with local hidden variable theories
It states that no physical theory of local hidden variables can ever reproduce all of the predictions of quantum mechanics
It states that local particle interactions cannot explain the observed correlations predicted by quantum mechanics
All of the above

questions.question: What does a 'wave packet' in quantum mechanics represent?
options: A probability distribution of particles
A continuous spectrum of wave vectors
A discrete set of possible energy levels
A combination of several waves of different wavelengths
questions.correct_answer: A combination of several waves of different wavelengths

questions.question: What does the 'no-cloning theorem' state in quantum mechanics?
options: It is impossible to create an identical copy of an arbitrary unknown quantum state
It is impossible to measure the state of a quantum system without disturbing it
It is impossible to determine the path taken by a particle in a double-slit experiment
It is impossible to simultaneously know the exact position and momentum of a particle
questions.correct_answer: It is impossible to create an identical copy of an arbitrary unknown quantum state

questions.question: What does 'quantum entanglement' imply for the properties of entangled particles?
options: The properties of each particle are well-defined but correlated
The properties of each particle are not well-defined until they are measured
The properties of each particle can be instantly changed by manipulating the other
Both B and C

questions.question: What is 'quantum Zeno effect'?
options: The tendency of quantum systems to remain in their initial state while they are observed
The phenomenon where the direction of a particle's spin is reversed under observation
The phenomenon where a quantum system simultaneously exists in several possible states
The phenomenon where quantum states change when they are measured
questions.correct_answer: The tendency of quantum systems to remain in their initial state while they are observed

questions.question: In the context of quantum computing, what is a 'qubit'?
options: The basic unit of quantum information
The basic unit of classical information
A type of quantum entanglement
A type of quantum superposition
questions.correct_answer: The basic unit of quantum information

questions.question: Which phenomenon explains the interference pattern in the double-slit experiment?
options: Wave-particle duality
Uncertainty principle
Quantum entanglement
Quantum teleportation
